intro: Eruca orthosepala, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery flavor similar to that of arugula. Eruca orthosepala is often grown as a leafy green vegetable in home gardens and is valued for its nutritional content and culinary uses.
